intro: Lappula mogoltavica, commonly known as the Mongolian lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellowish, often arranged in clusters. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
